sections.title: Sustainable Retirement Income
sections.subtitle: Creating reliable income streams for your retirement years

sections.title: Retirement Income Sources
sections.content: Typical retirement income comes from Social Security, pensions (if available), retirement account withdrawals, investment income, and potentially part-time work or rental income. Understanding these sources and how they interact is crucial for financial security in retirement.

points.title: Guaranteed Income
points.description: Social Security, pensions, and annuities provide predictable income regardless of market conditions.

points.title: Investment Income
points.description: Dividends, interest, and systematic withdrawals from investment portfolios.

points.title: Flexible Income
points.description: Part-time work, rental income, or business income that can be adjusted based on needs.

sections.title: Sequence of Returns Risk
sections.content: Poor investment returns early in retirement can significantly impact your portfolio's longevity. Having guaranteed income sources helps mitigate this risk.

sections.title: Withdrawal Strategies
sections.content: The 4% rule provides a starting point for sustainable withdrawals. Consider dynamic strategies that adjust based on market performance and your age. Tax-efficient withdrawal sequencing can also improve outcomes.

sections.title: Plan Your Retirement Income
steps: Identify all potential sources of retirement income
Calculate your expected annual retirement expenses
Develop a withdrawal strategy for your investment portfolio
Consider purchasing an annuity for guaranteed income if needed

sections.title: Stress Test Your Plan
sections.content: Use retirement calculators that simulate different market scenarios to test how your plan performs in various economic conditions.
